title: Fantasy Marathon mock draft: 'Big 4' quarterbacks all go in Round 3
content: The annual event concluded with a 10-team mock, during which two tight ends were drafted before the first quarterback was taken.

title: Ohtani pitches into 5th but Angels rally for sweep
content: Shohei Ohtani returned to the Angel Stadium mound with 4⅓ innings of five-hit, four-run ball for the Dodgers on Wednesday night in his first pitching appearance in Anaheim since he left the Angels nearly two years ago.

title: NBA signs off on record-setting sale of Celtics
content: The NBA board of governors unanimously approved the sale of the Celtics to a group led by private equity mogul Bill Chisholm, a deal that values the franchise at more than $6.1 billion.

title: Ex-Broncos receiving great Taylor dies at age 89
content: Lionel Taylor, an original Denver Bronco and a member of the team's Ring of Fame, has died at age 89.

title: Cowboys' Jones: Experimental drug saved my life
content: Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones said in an interview that he dealt with Stage 4 melanoma and that an experimental trial drug saved his life.

title: Brewers come through, win free burgers for city
content: Brandon Woodruff admitted there was "a little bit more at stake" Wednesday night when he pitched the Brewers to their 12th straight win, which meant free burgers for the entire city of Milwaukee.

title: First-half fracas results in 3 ejections in Sky-Sun
content: Three players were ejected from the Sun's win over the Sky on Wednesday night following an altercation involving the Sun's Bria Hartley and the Sky's Rebecca Allen and Ariel Atkins.

title: Cubs' Amaya headed back to IL day after return
content: Cubs catcher Miguel Amaya was carted off the field after spraining his left ankle while stepping on first base Wednesday night at Toronto.

title: Pulisic slams 'cop-out' criticism by ex-U.S. players
content: United States stars Christian Pulisic and Timothy Weah have called out "evil" and "cop-out" criticism from former national team players in a recently released episode of the Paramount+ "Pulisic" documentary.

title: 🎤 Swift makes 'New Heights' podcast cameo
content: The superstar debuted on Jason and Travis Kelce's "New Heights" podcast, talked about becoming a football fan

title: How worried should Mets, Yankees be? ESPN insiders break it down
content: Not long ago, both N.Y. teams seemed to be cruising toward October -- then things took a turn for the worse.

title: How Knicks fans deal with being on MSG's banned list
content: Despite backlash, MSG Entertainment's "attorney exclusion list" is still in effect, reportedly banning over a thousand lawyers since 2022.

title: Predicting the best, worst scenarios for every NFL team: Who can surpass 10 wins this season?
content: We simulated best-case and worst-case scenarios for every team, and our NFL reporters picked the biggest variables.

title: After suffering a catastrophic injury, can UNC quarterback Max Johnson get his career back on track?
content: The son of Brad Johnson is entering his sixth year of college after rehabbing a broken leg, still hoping that he can play his way into the NFL draft.

title: Tottenham's Super Cup slipup reveals difficult task ahead for Frank
content: With Tottenham's loss to Paris Saint-Germain in the UEFA Super Cup, it will serve as a wake-up call for head coach Thomas Frank about the challenges in the future.

title: Predicting 2025-26, from Premier League title race to most entertaining teams
content: The new season has arrived! Which teams will win silverware? Who is poised to surprise? We asked our writers to predict it all, then drop their boldest, spiciest take for the campaign.

title: 10 biggest WNBA games that will determine the 2025 playoff race
content: From a Lynx-Liberty showdown to the Sept. 11 regular-season finale, these are the most impactful WNBA games left.

title: 11 second-year players who could break out this season
content: These super sophomores could make a significant impact, including on the College Football Playoff race.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: How Jerry Jones' contract negotiations cost the Cowboys $100M
content: What is going on in Dallas? The Micah Parsons situation is just the latest in a line of costly mistakes.

title: Lurking concerns for top 10 NBA contenders for the 2025-26 season
content: These 10 NBA franchises have the best chance to capture the NBA title. What hurdles will they have to overcome to raise the Larry O'Brien Trophy?

title: LaLiga questions: Barcelona-Madrid title race; Mbappé vs. Yamal
content: The new LaLiga season is upon us! Will Barcelona and Real Madrid dominate? Will Atlético spoil the party? Will Mbappé or Yamal shine brightest?

title: Coach? Star? Captain? All gone. Leverkusen's rebuild is total
content: A year after wining the Bundesliga, Leverkusen are rebuilding without their genius coach and star players.

title: Michael Phelps offers swim lessons at Ravens training camp
content: The 23-time Olympic gold medalist gave some words of wisdom to the Baltimore Ravens before offering up swim lessons.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool agree deal with defender Leoni
content: Liverpool have verbally agreed to personal terms with Parma defender Giovanni Leoni. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 2025 NFL betting preview: Three picks to make on your favorite team
content: Will your team beat its projected win total? What props should you target? Here are three bets we like for every NFL team.

title: Teams we like to beat or fall short of projected win totals
content: Who will exceed projections and who will fall short? Our analysts offer their best bets on teams' win totals.

title: J&K statehood case: SC says can't ignore incidents like Pahalgam; seeks Centre's response
content: The Supreme Court emphasized the need to consider the ground reality in Jammu and Kashmir, citing incidents like Pahalgam, before restoring its statehood. The Centre has been asked to respond within eight weeks to a plea seeking immediate restoration.

title: Renukaswamy murder case: SC cancels actor Darshan's bail; top court orders his immediate arrest
content: The Supreme Court overturned the Karnataka High Court's decision, cancelling the bail of Kannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa, his girlfriend Pavithra Gowda, and five others implicated in the Renukaswamy murder case. Darshan was arrested with 16 others for allegedly abducting, torturing, and murdering Renukaswamy, a 33-year-old fan.

title: 'Vocal minority vs silent majority': Larger SC bench hears stray dogs case; stay on order sought
content: The Supreme Court addressed the escalating stray dog issue, criticizing civic authorities for neglecting existing regulations. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta highlighted the severity of dog bite incidents and rabies deaths, emphasizing the need for a solution balancing animal welfare and public safety. Senior advocates argued against the order to catch stray dogs, questioning the availability of shelter homes and sterilization efforts, as the court reserves its decision.

title: 'Secondary tariffs could go up …': US warns of higher sanctions on India
content: The Trump administration is threatening India with higher tariffs if upcoming US-Russia talks in Alaska fail, potentially increasing the existing 50% tariffs on Indian exports. These secondary tariffs, particularly the 25% levy on crude oil trade with Russia, are aimed at pressuring Putin to resolve the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: Trade war: 'Don't want your Nvidia AI chips,' China tells Trump; US President called it 'obsolete'
content: China is reportedly pressuring tech giants like Alibaba and ByteDance to reduce orders for Nvidia's H20 AI chips, favoring domestic alternatives. Regulators are questioning companies about their preference for Nvidia over local options like Huawei and Cambricon. This move complicates Nvidia's export arrangement, even after receiving clearance from the Trump administration, who deemed the H20 chip 'obsolete'.

title: Dr. Vece Paes, Olympic bronze medallist, passes away at age 80
content: Dr. Vece Paes, an Olympic hockey bronze medalist from the 1972 Munich Games and a pioneer in sports medicine, passed away at 80. Beyond his hockey achievements, he excelled in cricket, football, and rugby, later leading the Indian Rugby Football Union. Dr.

title: Cloudbursts trigger flash floods in Himachal: Over 300 roads blocked, bridges swept away
content: Cloudbursts and flash floods wreaked havoc across Himachal Pradesh, impacting Kullu, Shimla, and Lahaul-Spiti districts. Evacuations were carried out in affected areas of Kullu following cloudbursts near Shrikhand Mahadev and Batahar village, resulting in property damage but no loss of life.

title: 'Shouldn't have had a place': Irfan Pathan's brutal take on Rohit Sharma playing Test cricket in 2024
content: Irfan Pathan suggested that Rohit Sharma's place in the Test team was potentially in jeopardy during 2024 due to poor performances, particularly highlighting his struggles in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Pathan acknowledged the perception of biased support towards Sharma, and argued that he only kept his place in the squad because he was captain.

title: Audi employees in Germany to the company: Cannot build a factory in America without ...
content: Audi's plan to establish a U.S. plant faces hurdles as labor leaders prioritize securing German jobs amidst President Trump's tariffs. The labor official, Jörg Schlagbauer, insists on long-term guarantees for German production before supporting U.S. expansion. Trump's tariffs, impacting European carmakers, prompt Audi to consider U.S.

title: Mass shooting in US: Three sheriff deputies shot in southern Virginia
content: A shooting incident occurred in Pittsylvania County, Virginia. Several law enforcement officers sustained injuries. Representative John McGuire expressed support for the injured deputies and their families. He mentioned that he is closely monitoring the situation. Pittsylvania County is located near the border of North Carolina. Further details are awaited as the situation unfolds.

title: Jalgaon village tense: Youth caught with girl at café beaten to death
content: In Jalgaon's Jamner, a 20-year-old man was fatally beaten by a group of nine due to his relationship with a minor. Police have arrested four individuals and are searching for the remaining five involved in the attack. The victim was assaulted at a café and later at his village bus stand, where his parents were also attacked when they intervened.

title: Watch: Man throws Subway sandwich at federal agent
content: Sean Charles Dunn, 37, faces a felony assault charge after throwing a Subway sandwich at a federal agent in Washington, D.C. The incident, captured in a viral video, shows Dunn shouting "fascists" before the assault. This occurred amidst increased federal presence in the city, following President Trump's deployment of agents to assist local police, leading to numerous arrests for various offenses.

title: Hiring in the AI era: Nvidia CEO on Nepotism; “Parents wouldn’t recommend their kids if…”
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang defended the company's hiring practices, addressing concerns about nepotism by stating that parents wouldn't recommend their children if they weren't capable. His comments come as his own children, Madison and Spencer, have risen to prominent positions in emerging business divisions, despite initial career paths outside of technology. Both siblings have reportedly exceeded targets in their roles.

title: Arjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok – What’s the net worth of her family’s business empire?
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of cricket icon Sachin Tendulkar, is engaged to Saaniya Chandok, granddaughter of Mumbai businessman Ravi Ghai. Saaniya's family is deeply involved in the food and hospitality sector, managing brands like The Brooklyn Creamery and Baskin Robbins India.

title: Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra booked; EOW probes Rs 60cr fraud; businessman alleges fund misuse
content: Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra are under investigation by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) for allegedly defrauding a businessman of ₹60.4 crore. The couple, along with an unidentified individual, are accused of misappropriating funds from Deepak Kothari, intended for their now-defunct company, Best Deal TV Pvt Ltd, between 2015 and 2023.

title: 'Tragic chapter': PM Modi pays tribute to victims of 1947 Partition
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi observed Partition Horrors Remembrance Day, commemorating the immense suffering and loss endured during the 1947 Partition. Leaders like Amit Shah and S Jaishankar also paid tribute, highlighting the tragedy's lasting impact and the importance of unity. The day serves as a reminder of the human cost of division and the need to strengthen harmony.

title: Karachi aerial firing: Pakistan Independence Day turns deadly: 3 killed, over 60 injured
content: Pakistan's independence day celebrations in Karachi turned tragic as reckless aerial firing resulted in the deaths of three individuals, including a senior citizen and an 8-year-old girl. Over 60 others sustained gunshot injuries across the city. This incident follows a disturbing trend, with Karachi experiencing a high number of shooting-related fatalities earlier in the year.

title: Climate crisis: Pacific nation goes digital to preserve culture
content: Tuvalu, a Pacific island nation of 11,000, faces potential relocation due to rising sea levels. NASA reports a 15 cm rise in sea levels around Tuvalu in the last 30 years, threatening habitability by mid-century. Challenges include infrastructure risk, freshwater scarcity, and economic disruption. Tuvalu is also planning to become the first digital nation, preserving its culture and sovereignty virtually.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex near 80,600
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday. While Nifty50 was above 24,600, BSE Sensex was near 80,600.

title: 'I’ll cherish it forever' – Shubman Gill reflects after ICC player of the month award
content: Shubman Gill expressed immense joy upon receiving the ICC Men’s Player of the Month award for July, coinciding with his captaincy debut in the Test series. Gill highlighted his double century in Birmingham as a cherished moment, contributing to his impressive 754 runs in the Anderson Tendulkar Trophy.

title: Honour killing in UP: Teen beheaded for 'disgracing' family
content: In a shocking incident in Hathras, a 19-year-old woman was allegedly murdered and beheaded by her father, stepmother, and step-grandfather in an act of suspected "honour killing." The victim, identified as Tamanna, was believed to have "disgraced" the family after leaving home with a man and returning.

title: 'Appreciate anti-terror effort': US wishes Pakistan on Independence; hails 'trade ties'
content: On Pakistan's Independence Day, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio acknowledged Pakistan's counterterrorism and trade efforts. Rubio highlighted the Trump administration's interest in exploring economic cooperation in critical minerals and hydrocarbons. This warming relationship, marked by expanded engagement beyond traditional areas, is drawing attention amid regional tensions and strategic shifts.

title: Rajasthan Royals ask for Jadeja or Ruturaj in swap deal for Sanju Samson
content: Sanju Samson's future with Rajasthan Royals is uncertain as the franchise explores trade possibilities, with owner Manoj Badale leading discussions with other IPL teams. RR reportedly approached Chennai Super Kings, expressing interest in Ravindra Jadeja or Ruturaj Gaikwad in exchange for Samson, but CSK is unwilling to release these key players.

title: Delhi-NCR wakes to heavy showers: Streets waterlogged, traffic crawls
content: Delhi and NCR experienced heavy rainfall, leading to waterlogging and traffic disruptions in several areas. The weather is expected to intensify from August 14 to 17, with increased rainfall and humidity. Authorities have cautioned commuters about potential congestion, especially around ceremonial routes, advising them to take precautions during this wet spell.

title: 'Misused Pak air space closure exemption': DGCA warns AI on pilot duty violations
content: India's aviation regulator, DGCA, has cautioned Air India for misusing pilot flight duty exemptions granted during Pakistan's airspace closure in April 2025. Air India allegedly reduced cockpit crew on unaffected flights, leading to safety concerns. The DGCA deemed Air India's explanation unsatisfactory and warned the CEO to ensure strict compliance with aviation regulations.

title: Crypto surge: Bitcoin hits record high, smashing past $124k
content: Bitcoin soared to a record high of $124,500 on Thursday, driven by positive US market sentiment and regulatory changes. Analysts attribute the surge to President Trump's policies easing restrictions on crypto firms, encouraging institutional investment. Major players like Trump's media group and Tesla have significantly contributed to the rally.

title: Bid that bagged the 12 Earth Observation satellites PPP Project quoted Rs 0
content: In an unprecedented move, a consortium including Pixxel and SatSure won a major Earth Observation satellite project with a bid of ₹0, committing to invest over ₹1,200 crore. This signals strong private sector confidence in India's space economy, with the consortium aiming to recover their investment through diverse applications like agriculture and disaster assessment.

title: Delhi traffic advisory: Curbs imposed on these routes
content: Central Delhi anticipates traffic disruptions on Thursday due to Janmashtami and Tazia processions, as per police advisory. Paharganj will be significantly affected from 1:30 pm. The Janmashtami procession starts from Mandir Shri Banke Bihari Ji, while the Tazia procession commences from Ajmeri Gate. Chelmsford Road, Arakashan Road, and Desh Bandhu Gupta Road will face restrictions and diversions.

title: Arjun Tendulkar gets engaged to Saaniya Chandok; who is she?
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of cricket icon Sachin Tendulkar, is now engaged to Saaniya Chandok in a private ceremony attended by close family and friends. Saaniya, granddaughter of Mumbai industrialist Ravi Ghai, hails from a prominent business family known for ventures like the InterContinental hotel and Brooklyn Creamery.

title: Diabetes dietitian recommends four foods to lower blood sugar to non-diabetic level
content: Diabetes is a growing concern in the US, affecting millions. Experts Diana Licalzi & Jose Tejero suggest incorporating beans, broccoli, edamame, and berries into your diet. These foods are rich in fiber, protein, and compounds that improve insulin sensitivity and help manage blood sugar levels, potentially aiding in diabetes reversal.

title: International experts back IAF chief's remark on downing of Pakistan jets
content: International analysts corroborate Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh's claims regarding Operation Sindoor, confirming the IAF's downing of multiple Pakistani jets, including a Saab 2000 early warning aircraft. Expert Tom Cooper highlights the S-400 missile system's successful strike at 300 km, a potential world record.

title: San Antonio Spurs: $229 mn gamble; why De’Aaron Fox landed one of NBA’s most..
content: De'Aaron Fox's massive contract with the San Antonio Spurs sparks debate. The deal raises questions about NBA overspending. Fox, a talented player, now earns superstar money. He joins a list of players with debated contracts. Teams face pressure to retain talent. This deal reflects rising NBA salaries. It highlights the challenges of balancing value and cost in the league.

title: Life in jail, Rs 10 lakh fine: Uttarakhand conversion bill gets stringent
content: Uttarakhand's cabinet approved a stringent amendment to the Freedom of Religion Act, targeting forced conversions with penalties up to life imprisonment and a ₹10 lakh fine. The bill, expected to pass in the upcoming assembly session, increases jail terms and allows arrests without warrants.

title: Dadar Kabutarkhana row escalates into Jain–Marathi manus face-off
content: Tensions flared in Mumbai as Marathi Ekikaran Samiti members protested the Jain community's demand to continue pigeon feeding at Dadar Kabutarkhana. Hundreds were detained after protesting remarks by a Jain monk who threatened action if the practice was banned.

title: Nasa intern Thad Roberts stole $21m in moon rocks from Johnson Space Center for love
content: In 2002, Thad Roberts, a NASA intern, stole moon rocks from Johnson Space Center. He was aided by Tiffany Fowler and Shae Saur. The stolen rocks were valued at $21 million. Roberts claimed it was for love, but the FBI found he planned to sell them. Roberts and his accomplices were arrested. The heist damaged scientific research.

title: India acts minimally, Pakistan rarely acts against rights abuses: US
content: The US government released a human rights report noting abuses in India and Pakistan. The report stated India took minimal steps to combat abuses. Pakistan rarely took credible steps. The report documented instances in 2024. Rights groups fault Narendra Modi's government for its treatment of minorities. India denies discrimination and says its policies benefit everyone.

title: Lab-grown rabies antibodies show promise as safe alternative
content: A recent clinical trial, funded by a pharmaceutical company and published in The Lancet, suggests a lab-made rabies immunoglobulin could replace animal and human-derived versions in India's public hospitals. This shift promises a safer, more affordable option for preventing rabies after dog bites.

title: Taylor Swift on New Heights: Patrick Mahomes says ‘They called Brittany’; post-show FaceTime buzz
content: Taylor Swift's 'New Heights' debut created buzz. Patrick Mahomes revealed he knew about Swift's appearance beforehand. After recording, Swift and Travis Kelce FaceTimed Brittany Mahomes. Patrick was awkwardly present. This highlights the Mahomes-Kelce-Swift connection. The episode included Swift's album announcement. Mahomes found himself amidst pop culture's excitement. He anticipates more such moments in the future.

title: In a 1st in India, Goa to negotiate lower prices for life-saving therapies
content: Goa pioneers a groundbreaking pricing policy to enhance access to costly cancer and rare disease treatments. The state government will negotiate lower drug and equipment prices with pharmaceutical firms, enabling broader patient coverage.

title: DMK neta's wife refuses to collect PhD from Tamil Nadu governor
content: During Manonmaniam Sundaranar University's convocation, a PhD scholar, Jean Joseph, protested Governor R.N. Ravi's presence by refusing to accept her degree from him, citing his opposition to Tamil Nadu's welfare. She instead posed with the vice-chancellor, expressing her support for the Dravidian governance model. BJP leader K. Annamalai criticized her actions as a politically motivated stunt by the DMK.

title: Meghalaya asks Centre to convince Bangladesh to erect fencing close to International Border
content: "We have taken up with the MHA, urging it to convince the government of Bangladesh, let us go close to the main pillar of the border so that we can avoid fencing outside the village," Deputy CM of Meghalaya Prestone Tynsong said

title: Watch: How many stray dogs are there in India? No one knows
content: We show why India’s dog population figures are so unreliable, how this affects vaccination, sterilisation, and shelter planning, and why counting them right is the first step toward solving the stray dog crisis.

title: Consider ground realities, remember Pahalgam attack: Supreme Court tells petitioners seeking restoration of J&K Statehood
content: The CJI turned to the petitioners to observe that “you have to take into consideration the ground realities... Remember what happened in Pahalgam”

title: Congress accuses Modi govt of being 'biased' in allocating semiconductor projects
content: Much earlier similar transfer of locations were forced through. Two semiconductor manufacturing projects were compelled to shift their proposed location from Telangana to Gujarat, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Anbumani, Vijay slam DMK government over detention of protesting conservancy workers in Chennai
content: In a post on X, Dr. Anbumani said their detention is shocking, and that oppressing those who fight for their rights is “condemnable and inexcusable.”

title: Flag sales down to a quarter in country’s first BIS-recognised national flag manufacturing unit in Karnataka
content: Amendment to flag code, which allows polyester flags, is the main reason cited for sales coming down year after year

title: At the heart of the Bihar SIR dispute is the basic natural justice principle: hear a person before causing harm
content: There are stringent standards and procedures set out by statutory laws to guide the ECI on the registration of names in the electoral rolls. These laws balance out the ECI’s power of superintendence over elections under Article 324 with the ordinary citizens’ or the “little man’s” right to vote enshrined in Article 326 of the Constitution and Section 62 of the Representation of the People (RP) Act

title: Nine including seven militants arrested in Manipur
content: “A joint team of Manipur Police and Assam Rifles arrested one active member of the banned Kangleipak Communist Party involved in extortion activity,” the police said

title: Man beaten to death by ten persons, four held; police probing various angles
content: Police suspect an old enmity led to the murder of Suleiman Khan, who was preparing for the police recruitment exam

title: Renukaswamy murder case: Supreme Court cancels bail granted to actor Darshan
content: The Bench passed the order while hearing a plea filed by the State Government challenging the High Court’s December 13, 2024 order granting bail to actor Darshan and other co-accused

title: Punjab Police arrests two operatives of Lawrence Bishnoi gang
content: "In a major breakthrough, Anti Gangster Task Force (#AGTF) Punjab, arrests two most-wanted Lawrence Bishnoi gang operatives from #Patiala-#Ambala Highway near Village Shambhu," says DGP Gaurav Yadav on X

title: Equity markets climb in early trade on buying in HDFC Bank, TCS
content: Extending its previous day’s rally, the 30-share BSE Sensex climbed 154.07 points to 80,693.98 in early trade. The 50-share NSE Nifty went up by 45 points to 24,664.35

title: Amit Shah pays tributes to those who suffered during Partition, says Congress divided nation
content: On Partition Horrors Remembrance Day, Amit Shah said it is an occasion to express condolences by remembering the pain of those who suffered due to the Partition of the country.

title: Rajinikanth’s Coolie draws frenzy in Kerala’s Ernakulam with 350 houseful shows across 30-plus screens
content: Coolie has an added draw for Kerala audiences, with Malayalam actor Soubin Shahir’s dance in the song ‘Monica...’ going viral ahead of its release

title: Case filed against Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra for alleged ₹60 crore fraud
content: According to Mr. Kothari, in 2015, Ms. Shetty and Mr. Kundra approached him through a mediator seeking a ₹75 crore loan for their company, Best Deal TV Pvt Ltd, which promoted lifestyle products and ran an online shopping platform.

title: Bihar SIR row hearing LIVE: Supreme Court to continue hearing of pleas today
content: Supreme Court on Wednesday said that SIR is a battle between the Election Commission’s power, and the citizens’ right to vote

title: Two-day international conference on AI and machine learning at Vijayanagara Sri Krishnadevaraya University in Ballari
content: University Registrar C. Nagaraju observed that while humans invent technology, machines are now evolving to control humans

title: Chennai conservancy workers protests LIVE: Sanitation workers detained at midnight after 13-day protest
content: Around 600 protesters, including advocates and members of the Communist parties, were removed from the pavement near the Ripon Buildings

title: Fire at cafe located in residential building in Thane; 35 persons evacuated
content: The blaze erupted in the Parsik Cafe located on the ground floor of the six-storey building at Kharegaon in Kalwa (West)

title: Jagan in touch with Congress for a pact, alleges TDP
content: TDP said Jagan was sending former Minister and his close confidant Botcha Satyanarayana regularly to New Delhi to meet Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and discuss arrangements for a formal tie up

title: LIVE: Supreme Court reserves order on plea to stay directive for rounding up strays and placing them in shelters
content: Amid widespread outrage over its earlier directive, the Supreme Court has decided to place the matter before a larger Bench

title: Karnataka govt. to set up one delimitation commission for all five corporations
content: Deputy Chief Minister and Bengaluru Development Minister D.K. Shivakumar recently said that the final notification of the five corporations will be issued on September 2 and delimitation will begin on September 3. The final ward list will be notified by November 30

title: 3.1 magnitude quake wakes up Qutbullapur near Vikarabad
content: According to media reports, Rangapur, Barlapalli, and Nayamath Nagar were some of the villages where residents said they felt the tremors

title: Dating app investment scam: Man loses ₹13.3 lakh
content: The victim first invested ₹50,000 via IMPS, received a small profit, and successfully withdrew the amount, which built his trust in the platform. Over time, he deposited ₹8,00,000

title: Delhi court acquits Swati Maliwal accused of revealing rape victim's name
content: According to the FIR, the notice sent by Ms. Maliwal as the chairperson of DCW, in which she sought to know about the investigation in the rape case, was "intentionally circulated" on a WhatsApp group and shown by a TV channel.

title: India monsoon rains LIVE: Heavy rain batters Telangana; IMD issues ‘orange’ alert in Delhi as waterlogging hits traffic
content: The weather system has caused the eastern end of the monsoon trough to shift southwards. This is likely to bring widespread light to moderate rainfall, with isolated heavy to very heavy showers, in most parts of Uttar Pradesh, says IMD

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Ambadas Danve calls rice for children sent to Africa a scam
content: Mr. Danve challenged the government to have an open discussion on the issue, naming J.V. Grains Dealers, the social organisation involved in the alleged corruption

title: Deaf-mute woman gang-raped in U.P.; two accused arrested after encounter
content: In the 16-second viral video, the woman, seemingly barefoot, is seen being chased down a dimly lit deserted road by men on motorcycles

title: Chennai, the chosen land of superstar Rajinikanth
content: As the superstar, who has seen 74 summers, turns 50 in his celluloid career, it is time for Chennai and the rest of the world to welcome his latest action flick, ‘Coolie’, set to release in theatres today (August 14, 2025).

title: Pregnant woman carried through waist-deep water by family to cross swollen stream
content: The local police helped them cross the stream safely and shifted her to the government hospital in the mandal headquarters in an ambulance.

title: JE vaccination in seven more districts, more than 27 lakh children to be covered with a single dose
content: Focused vaccination campaigns will be held at government and government-aided schools, anganwadi centres, orphanages and juvenile homes.

title: Access to non-farm business, irrigation significantly reduces climate change-induced rural migration, says IIT Madras study
content: The IDHS study is a nationally representative, multi-topic panel survey of thousands of households in urban and rural areas across the country.

title: AIADMK govt. never hiked power tariff despite joining UDAY scheme: EPS
content: Palaniswami said his government joined the Central scheme only after the conditions set by Tamil Nadu were accepted; he also blamed the DMK government for consistently increasing the tariff

title: Reservoirs in Andhra Pradesh are 78% full
content: While the total gross capacity at Full Reservoir Level is 1,000.07 tmc ft, the storage now stands at 782.40 tmc ft, up from 672.93 tmc ft the same day the previous year

title: Four sworn-in permanent judges of Andhra Pradesh High Court
content: Harinath Nunepally, Kiranmayee Mandava, Sumathi Jagadam, and Nyapathy Vijay have earlier been additional judges of the High Court

title: Gujarat to get new veterinary college; admissions to start next month
content: Kamdhenu Veterinary College at Himatnagar  will offer 80 seats in the Bachelor of Veterinary Science and Animal Husbandry programmes, with admissions set to begin next month through NEET scores

title: "Trump Is Not Happy With India Because...": What Ex-Diplomat Said
content: One of the reasons behind Washington's punitive tariffs on New Delhi is that US President Donald Trump is miffed with India for ignoring his so-called role in brokering a peace deal with Pakistan following the recent military conflict.

title: Arab World Slams Netanyahu's 'Greater Israel' Remarks
content: The Arab League has condemned the statements made by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu regarding the annexation of parts of the territories of sovereign Arab states, in preparation for the establishment of what he called "Greater Israel."

title: "Nobody Above Law": Actor Darshan's Bail Cancelled By Supreme Court
content: In a major setback for Kannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa, the Supreme Court has cancelled his bail in a murder case, setting aside a Karnataka High Court order.

title: Donald Trump Signs Order Easing Space Regulations In A Boost To Elon Musk's SpaceX
content: The executive order, which said it aimed to "substantially" increase the number of space launches in the United States, was described by an environmental group as "reckless."

title: Over 1,000 To Receive Gallantry Awards On 15 August, Jammu And Kashmir Gets Most
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs has announced the official list of recipients of medals for Police, Fire Services, Home Guard & Civil Defence, and Correctional Services on the occasion of Independence Day on Friday.

title: "Fascist DMK": Superstar Vijay Vocal Over Sanitation Workers' Protest
content: Tamil superstar Vijay tore into the DMK government this morning, accusing the MK Stalin administration of arresting sanitation workers at midnight when they were protesting for their rights.

title: "Baseless, Malicious": Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra On Rs 60 Crore Fraud Case
content: In their response to a businessman's allegations of a Rs 60 crore fraud, actor Shilpa Shetty and husband Raj Kundra have said there is "no criminality involved" and the case against them is "baseless and malicious"

title: "Tragic Chapter Of Our History": PM Modi On Partition Horrors Remembrance Day
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said Partition Horrors Remembrance Day, which is observed annually on August 14, is a reminder of people's enduring responsibility to strengthen the bonds of harmony that hold the country together.

title: "Not Going To Lose Our Cool": Supreme Court On Another Faulty High Court Order
content: The top court was hearing an appeal by a couple against the Rajasthan High Court's refusal to grant them anticipatory bail in a case arising from an alleged unpaid amount for a plywood consignment.

title: PM Modi, Amit Shah Remember Horrors Of Partition, Pay Tribute To Victims
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday recalled the sufferings of countless people affected by India's partition and reiterated the commitment to strengthen the bonds of harmony that hold our country together.

title: Freedom From Gravity: How Private Companies Are Reshaping Access To Space
content: As India prepares for its first independent human space mission under the Gaganyaan program, the global landscape is witnessing a renaissance in space travel.

title: Chief Justice's Bench To Hear Petition For Restoration Of J&K's Statehood
content: A Supreme Court bench of Chief Justice of India BR Gavai and Justice K Vinod Chandran will shortly hear a petition for the restoration of statehood in Jammu and Kashmir. The petition seeks the implementation of a 2023 top court order.

title: MLA Holds 'Chappal' Protest In Rajasthan, Some Carry Away Footwear In Sacks
content: A "chappal (slipper) rally" was held in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh town on Wednesday to protest against the inefficiency of the electricity department.

title: Woman's Chilling Text To Boyfriend, Then Murder: Dishonour Killing In Gujarat
content: A Gujarat man received a chilling text on Instagram late at night. "Save me," read the text from his girlfriend. Hours later, her body was found at home. A suspicious turn of events led to an investigation, unearthing a brazen dishonour killing.

title: UP Teacher Comments On Student's 'Tilak', Activists Create Ruckus In School
content: The furore among the Hindu organisations began last month when two sisters, identified as Manu and Soni, got admission in the school for Class 11.

title: Uttarakhand Okays Revisions In Stricter Anti-Conversion Law With Heavy Fines
content: The Uttarakhand Cabinet on Wednesday approved amendments to the anti-conversion law to make it harsher, with stringent provisions like punishment up to life imprisonment and heavy fines being added to the new bill.

title: Tejashwi Yadav's Fresh Voter List Charge: NDA MP, Husband Have 2 Votes Each
content: Amid the buzz over voter lists and the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) in Bihar, Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav has alleged that an NDA MP and her MLC husband have two EPIC IDs

title: Heavy Rain In North India, Flooding, Traffic Chaos in Delhi Amid Red Alert
content: From the national capital, Delhi, waking up to heavy rain today, to a flash flood at Hojis Lungpa Nala in Kinnaur district of Himachal Pradesh, and an orange alert for heavy rain in Uttarakhand, the monsoon is intensifying in parts of North India.

title: Amid Row, Larger Top Court Bench To Review Order On Stray Dogs' Removal Today
content: A day after Chief Justice of India BR Gavai assured a relook at the two-judge bench order on moving all stray dogs in Delhi and the National Capital Region (NCR) to shelter homes, the matter is scheduled to be taken up by a larger bench on Thursday.

title: Bitcoin Hits Record High Above $1,24,000
content: The world's largest crypto-asset by market capitalisation climbed as much as 0.9% to $124,002.49 in early Asia trading, surpassing its previous peak hit in July.

title: 40 Thakur legislators announce formation of ‘kutumb parivar’
content: Attended mostly by BJP MLAs and MLCs, meeting also included two SP rebels and the lone BSP MLA; largely a non-political get-together: organiser

title: Police remove protesting conservancy workers in Chennai, shift them to marriage halls
content: Around 600 protesters, including advocates and members of the Communist parties, were removed from the pavement near the Ripon Buildings.

title: West Bengal migrant worker repatriated from Bangladesh after family moves Calcutta HC
content: Attempt being made to cover up the pushing back of the migrant worker into Bangladesh by the BSF and the Union government by repatriating him, says West Bengal Migrant Welfare Board chief Samirul Islam

title: Primary school teachers in Karnataka to boycott classes, go on an indefinite strike from September 3
content: Around 1.4 lakh government primary school teachers (PST) have decided to boycott classes and go on an indefinite strike from September 3 demanding the fulfilment of various demands

title: Thousands of forest rights titles go missing in Chhattisgarh records, officials claim ‘reporting error’
content: Community forest rights titles in Rajnandgaon halved from 40 to 20, according to monthly progress reports; Bastar sees individual titles drop by over 2,700, though there is no FRA process to withdraw titles

title: Kerala Cabinet approves ₹17 lakh for nurse remaining in coma after contracting Nipah
content: Cabinet approves pay hike for district government pleaders, public prosecutors, additional government pleaders and additional public prosecutors

title: Attend to transmission & land issues for achieving target of 500 GW RE generation, industry urges governments
content: ‘Renewable energy projects are suffering as governments have moved away from land responsibility’ say industry captains

title: Babulal Marandi demands judicial probe into alleged encounter killing of Surya Hansda in Jharkhand
content: The Leader of the Opposition in the Jharkhand Assembly referred to Hansda as a ‘public welfare activist’; Hansda contested Assembly elections on tickets from different political parties, including the BJP, and was wanted in several criminal cases

title: Farmers’ forum protest against Trump, seeks ban on corporates in agriculture
content: Protesters demand rollback of U.S. tariffs, scrapping of FTAs, repeal of labour codes, and protection of MSP

title: Red alert for South Coastal Andhra Pradesh as heavy rains set to continue
content: Mangalagiri records 19 cm of rainfall; low-pressure system over the Bay of Bengal likely to intensify, bringing extremely heavy rain to several districts on August 14

title: Two senior Maoists killed in Chhattisgarh
content: Vijay Reddy and Lokesh Salame were killed in an anti-Maoist operation conducted along the Banda Pahad hill under the Madanwada police station area

title: Man convicted of raping blind minor girl imprisoned for life
content: Jharsuguda district police secure conviction within 100 days of registration of case; the court also awarded compensation of ₹10,50,000 to the victim under the National Legal Services Authority’s  Compensation Scheme

title: Priyank flags more cases of ‘vote theft’
content: Wedding cards and hall tickets were used as address proof to register voters in Mahadevapura Assembly constituency, he alleged

title: State amended nine varsities’ laws to bypass binding UGC regulations: T.N. Governor
content: Governor, UGC on the same page in SC as petitioner-advocate Venkatachalapathy on the issue of legality of nine amended State Acts

title: Bill tabled to give more clarity on functioning of Greater Bengaluru Authority
content: It proposes to empower the GBA to make appointments of Group A (junior level) and Group B officers in accordance with the common cadre and recruitment rules

title: Villupuram Collector holds meeting with organisers of Vinayaka Chathurthi festival
content: The organisers have been instructed not to install statues measuring over 10 foot from the ground level, to obtain NOCs from tahsildars, lands owners. Only clay idols with water soluble paints are allowed, says Collector

title: Grand Sri Krishna Janmashtami celebrations planned at ISKCON Temple in Hubballi
content: Various rituals and programmes have been scheduled as part of the celebrations for three days starting tomorrow

title: Karnataka Agri Minister says urea shortage is a national problem
content: Stating that there was short-supply of urea from Centre, Karnataka Agriculture Minister alleges that just when the state was trying to convince farmers to switch over to alternatives like Nano urea, the Opposition parties had put the farmers in panic mode

title: Nearly 25 lakh people affected due to flood in 10 districts of Bihar
content: Chief Minister Nitish Kumar held a review meeting and asked the official concerned to remain alert on rising water level and provide all possible help to the affected people

title: Undocumented migrants leaving via eastern border tripled in 2025 compared to 2024, government data show
content: In 2024, as many as 1,049 undocumented people were apprehended while leaving the country while till July 15 this year, 3,536 undocumented people were caught by the BSF, a senior government official said.

title: About 5,000 special guests invited for 79th Independence Day celebrations at Red Fort
content: “As India continues its journey towards achieving the government’s vision of Viksit Bharat by 2047, this year’s celebrations will be held under the theme Naya Bharat,” the Union Mdinistry of Defence said in a statement.

title: T.N. govt. holds meeting with exporters amid concerns over U.S. tariffs
content: Minister for Industries T.R.B. Rajaa chairs meeting. Later, in a social media post, he said it was imperative to listen and understand the hurdles of exporters for a calibrated policy response

title: Every theatre must screen a Bengali film daily at prime time: Bengal government
content: Bengali film industry professionals welcome the move; the Trinamool government is placing the spotlight onto the Bengali language amidst attacks on Bengali-speaking migrants in other States

title: Visakhapatnam girls excel in roller skating, sharing their inspiring journey to success
content: Visakhapatnam skaters D Greeshma and Sivakoti Kshetra relive their journey to gold and silver at the Asian Roller Skating Championship, opening up about the training and passion that fuelled their success

title: Union Home Ministry approves first ever cadre review of BSF personnel
content: Spanning from Constable to Inspector, the implementation has already commenced, and will cover immediate promotions for 23,710 personnel

title: Domestic travel booms owing to long I-Day weekend in Karnataka
content: Tourists are opting for destinations in Karnataka which can be reached in a few hours owing to the limited time that the weekend offers

title: Rahul to lead 16-day ‘Vote Adhikar Yatra’ in Bihar as Congress intensifies fight against SIR
content: Yatra will pass through many areas where residents have complained of deletion of names in the SIR exercise; Congress to hold rallies in all States between August 22 and September 7

title: Jaishankar to visit Moscow; Wang Yi to be in New Delhi
content: India to step up engagements with China and Russia; move come amid uncertainty in trade ties with U.S. after it imposed high tariffs; China likely to continue border talks during its Foreign Minister’s visit

title: QFI-Chennai to host quiz competitions on August 16 and 17
content: ‘QFIesta’ will be held at the Music Academy Mini Hall, and is open to everyone. Each team can have a maximum of three members, and can register for the event the venue

title: 82% human-street dog encounters in India 'peaceful', research finds amid Supreme Court order
content: Reported human rabies cases in India have fallen by nearly 75% over the past two decades, from 274 in 2005 to 34 in 2022, largely due to mass dog vaccination and improved post-exposure prophylaxis

title: Borz is back: Why Khamzat Chimaev is only now fighting for a UFC title
content: new: "Borz" isn't thinking about any of that, but right now, he's not thinking about anything . new: he is preparing lunch at the camp, but today's itinerary has been thrown . he will fight for a title on august 19 at 10 p.m. ET on PPV .

title: Pacquiao title shot -- again? Joshua vs. Jake Paul? Canelo on canvas? Don't be surprised
content: the first eight months of 2025 have been interesting, to say the least . the last four months of the year will be dominated by Terence Crawford's bid to become a three-division undisputed champion when he makes the incomprehensible climb of two weight classes to 168 pounds to challenge Canelo Alvarez on sept. 13 .

title: Oneil Cruz hurt; Orioles shut down multiple pitchers
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . oneil Cruz left Tuesday's game after bumping heads with Jack Suwinski . he was replaced by a pinch hitter in the sixth inning .

title: Shedeur Sanders connects with referee that officiated collegiate debut
content: shedeur Sanders hasn't moved up on the Browns' depth chart . he played for the Jackson State Tigers in the Denny's Orange Blossom Classic . the rookie quarterback threw for 221 yards and completed 18 of 24 passes .

title: MLB Awards Watch: August update on MVP, CY Young and more
content: this month's awards watch reflects changes atop some races and separation in others . the two methods of tracking these things are in complete accord when it comes to anointing the current favorites . a lot can and will change in short period of time in a big league baseball season .

title: Ranking the top 50 players in baseball right now: MLB Rank 2025 in-season update
content: a week into the 2025 MLB season, we created our annual MLB Rank list . we asked 17 experts to give their ranking of the top 50 players in the sport this season . based on their overall impact on the season, the list features the MVPs and Cy Young Award winners you'd expect .

title: Supreme court ends IMA case against Patanjali on misleading ads
content: Gorgeous pictures of Sonia Aggarwal Rajinikanth’s style and makeover over the years Superstar turns golden: 50 years of Rajinikanth in pictures From Sridevi to Deepika Padukone: Bollywood actresses who worked with Rajinikanth Independence Day 2025: 10 Indian garments which are truly swadeshi Aishwarya Lekshmi – Where grace meets sunshine in every frame Lithium deficiency may trigger early dementia: 8 lithium-rich foods to add to the diet 10 baby names that mean creativity and vision When looks can be deceptive: 10 ‘PRETTY’ killers in the animal world Birthday Special: Spine-chilling quotes of Alfred Hitchcock that will keep you up at night

title: 'Write a check!': Why Terry McLaurin, Commanders can't get a deal done
content: wide receiver Terry McLaurin bounded out of the team's facility two weeks ago . he entered the final season of a three-year deal he signed in 2022 . his mood mirrored what the commanders have insisted about him .

title: Parliamentary panel slams 'perpetual tolling' on national highways
